---

:::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="8%"}
:::
::: {.column width="2%"}
:::
::: {.column width="90%"}
My current research focuses on identifying the cancer cell subpopulations responsible for relapse and understanding how microenvironments influence their response to treatment. We take high-throughput genomic analysis approaches, including single-cell RNA-seq, spatial, multiomics, and perturbation sequencing, to study cancer's origin, progression, and therapeutic resistance.  The ultimate goal is to improve cancer treatment precision, minimize disease recurrence risk, and enhance patient outcomes.



:::

## Computational biology and cancer genomics
:::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="8%"}
:::
::: {.column width="2%"}
:::
::: {.column width="90%"}
My current research focuses on identifying the cancer cell subpopulations responsible for relapse and understanding how microenvironments influence their response to treatment. We take high-throughput genomic analysis approaches, including single-cell RNA-seq, spatial, multiomics, and perturbation sequencing, to study cancer's origin, progression, and therapeutic resistance.  The ultimate goal is to improve cancer treatment precision, minimize disease recurrence risk, and enhance patient outcomes.



:::
